title: Notable & Quotable: A Fridge Full of Infrastructure
sub_head: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand’s redefinition of the word meets ridicule.
body:
Tamar Lapin writing in the New York Post, April 7:

Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand on Wednesday tried to redefine “infrastructure”—and got torn down on social media for it. . . .
The New York Democrat attempted to pave a new meaning, tweeting: “Paid leave is infrastructure. Child care is infrastructure. Caregiving is infrastructure.” . . .
Journalist Josh Barro joked that, “Mayonnaise is infrastructure. It supports the other flavors in the sandwich.”
